title: How to Show Lowercase Keys on an iPhone: Beginner's Guide

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the gray cog icon. Make sure your iPhone is updated to the latest version.

steps.title: Tap Accessibility.
steps.content: Tap Accessibility . You'll need to scroll down to find this option. It's a few settings underneath General .

steps.title: Tap Keyboards.
steps.content: Tap Keyboards . This is underneath the Physical and Motor header.

steps.title: Toggle on "Show Lowercase Keys".
steps.content: Toggle on "Show Lowercase Keys". When you use the Shift key to switch between uppercase and lowercase, you'll now see lowercase letters when the mode is active.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the gray cog icon. Use this method if you want to stop your iPhone from capitalizing the first word of every sentence. This will allow you to type in all lowercase. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap General.
steps.content: Tap General . You may need to scroll down to find this.

steps.title: Tap Keyboard.
steps.content: Tap Keyboard . This is underneath Date & Time .

steps.title: Toggle off "Auto-Capitalization".
steps.content: Toggle off "Auto-Capitalization". When you type, words will no longer be automatically capitalized. You can also enable the double tap period shortcut and slide to type feature on this page.
